results.title: Raise the red lantern
results.creator_credit: Zhang Yimou, Fu-Sheng Chiu, China Film and Era International
results.brief_description: On the death of her father Songlian is forced to leave her University studies and becomes the fourth concubine to a rich man. She enters a world in which a rigid ancestral code dictates the day to day existence of the four wives. Every night a red lantern is raised outside the boudoir of the wife who will be “graced” with the husband’s sexual favours. The women, though equally unhappy, are further divided by the competition to give birth to a son. The beautiful palatial house in which the women are enclosed slowly loses its allure as the closed, hermetic world in which the women exist is revealed as a physical and emotional prison. The ravishing cinematography and set design is itself a symbolic commentary on the abuses of power involved in the maintenance of “ancestral privilege”. As the seasons pass Songlian is stripped of her humanity, dignity and her power. Based on the novel “Wives and Concubines” by Su Tong. Gong Li stars as Songlian. This film was perceived as an attack on the Chinese establishment and banned although elsewhere, it was widely acclaimed and earned an Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Film. Winner of the Silver Lion at Venice Film Festival, 1992. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The BFG
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall and Cosgrove-Hall Productions
results.brief_description: Adapted from Roald Dahl’s best-selling children’s book, this animated feature tells the story of Sophie, a little orphan girl and her friend, the Big Friendly Giant (the BFG). Sophie and the BFG set out to rid the world of the gruesome “crunching giants” who gobble up children for breakfast. Sophie decides the only person powerful enough to help them is the Queen of England - but will she help?

results.title: Cocoon: the return (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Daniel Petrie, Lili Zanuck, David Brown, Richard Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The space travellers return to earth on a special rescue mission to retrieve their alien friends who lay at the bottom of the ocean, sleeping in cocoons. However, scientists have opened one of the pods and the innocent alien inside is to be turned over to the military who want to exploit its mental abilities. Meanwhile, the returning earthlings each react differently to being back on earth and seeing their loved ones again. When the time comes to leave, some will go to live forever and some will stay on Earth to live out the remainder of their lives. Stars Don Ameche, Wilford Brimley, Courtney Cox, Hume Cronyn, Jack Gilford, Steve Guttenberg, Barret Oliver, Maureen Stapleton, Elaine Stritch, Jessica Tandy, Gwen Verdon and Tahnee Welch.

results.title: Cocoon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Lili Zanuck, David Brown, Richard Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Ron Howard’s enchanting sci-fi fantasy about a group of resident senior citizens in a Florida rest home who discover a fountain of youth from another planet is close to being the ultimate in feelgood movies. Their lives turned upside down when they meet some bizarre and not-so-human beings who are visitors from a distant galaxy. They have come to Earth on a rescue mission to retrieve a secret which has lain hidden on the ocean floor for thousands of years. They share a wondrous adventure and learn more about love and friendship than they ever imagined. Cast includes Don Ameche, Wilford Brimley, Hume Cronyn, Brian Dennehy, Jack Gifford, Steve Guttenberg, Maureen Stapleton, Jessica Tandy, Gwen Verdon, Herta Ware and Tahnee Welch.

results.title: The Sound of music (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Argyle and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Sound of music, the most popular movie musical of all time, is a heart warming, inspirational and true story based on the lives of the Trapp Family Singers. Julie Andrews is Maria, a spirited, young Austrian woman who becomes governess to the children of the autocratic widower Baron von Trapp (Christopher Plummer). She brings warmth and music to the strict household of the reserved former naval captain, and soon wins over the children - and finally the baron as well.

results.title: My fair lady (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The dazzling film version of Lerner and Loewe’s acclaimed musical. Audrey Hepburn stars as the cockney flowergirl Eliza Doolittle who is trained by Professor Higgins (Rex Harrison) to pass as a duchess. Featuring sumptuous cinematography and costumes by Cecil Beaton, this is one of the most popular musicals ever filmed. Winner of eight Academy Awards including Best Picture. The original musical is based on George Bernard Shaw’s “Pygmalion”.

results.title: Alien (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Walter Hill, David Gilger, Gordon Carroll and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A sci-fi thriller with a difference. The crew aboard the space freighter Nostromo investigate a distress call and one of the crew brings back on board an Alien of unknown origin. In comparison to the technology dominated sterile world controlled by a computer, where no-one trusts anyone, the horror of the Alien is its very organic nature. Under Scott’s direction this film is grippingly suspenseful and draws interesting parallels between the perfect inhumanity of the Alien and that of the company. Stars Sigourney Weaver, Dean Stanton and John Hurt.

results.title: The African Queen (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: James Agee, John Huston, Sam Spiegel, Horizon (GB) and Horizon (US)
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart is the gin-soaked river tramp who reluctantly becomes a hero after rescuing a “skinny-psalm-singing-old-maid” (Katherine Hepburn) from the Germans during World War I. Their hazardous mission of escape becomes a pursuit as the odd pair survive malaria, insects, leeches and the persistent conflict of their personalities in order to destroy a German gunboat in the African Congo. Bogart won an Oscar for this role and the script was co-written by James Agee, based on C. S. Forester’s novel.

results.title: The Abyss (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An American nuclear submarine is mysteriously attacked by an unidentified vessel and when the crew of the submarine go deep into the ocean bed to investigate they find a force so powerful it threatens the future of humankind. Technically a masterpiece, with awesome set designs and special effects, and a chilling soundtrack, “The Abyss” is a terrifying movie. Directed by James Cameron (“Aliens”), “The Abyss” is an extravagantly mannerist example of the science-fiction genre in which the “dark force” is a mirror for the destructive powers which humans unleash on themselves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: High anxiety (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Crossbow Films and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘High Anxiety’ is a parody of, and a dedication to, the cinema of Alfred Hitchcock. Using the simple plot of a psychiatrist with a fear of heights who arrives to take up a top post as head of the Institute for the Very, Very Nervous, Mel Brooks uses a gamut of scatological, Freudian and slap-stick jokes to create hilarious parodies of famous scenes in ‘The Birds’, ‘Psycho’, ‘Vertigo’ et. al. Cast includes Cloris Leachman, Madeline Kahn and Harvey Korman. The script was co-written by Barry Levinson.
